prototype
Class SwingPointTracker

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  prototype.SwingPointTracker
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, motej.event.IrCameraListener
public class SwingPointTracker
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements motej.event.IrCameraListener

Listens for points from the Wiimote and draws them to the screen.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

points

private motej.IrPoint[] points
The points we've seen as of the last update. The Wiimote has 4 "slots" that it uses to report IR points.

xAdjust

private static final int xAdjust
Maximum X coordinate.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

yAdjust

private static final int yAdjust
Maximum Y coordinate.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SwingPointTracker

public SwingPointTracker()
Create a new point tracker.

Method Detail

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Draws the 4 points from the last Wiimote update.
Slot 0 is drawn in Red.
Slot 1 is drawn in Green.
Slot 2 is drawn in Blue.
Slot 3 is drawn in White.

Overrides:
paint in class javax.swing.JComponent

irImageChanged

public void irImageChanged(motej.event.IrCameraEvent evt)
This is called whenever the Wiimote senses a change in the position of an IR point. It paints the new changes.

Specified by:
irImageChanged in interface motej.event.IrCameraListener
